intro: Cyrtandra grayana f. grandis, commonly known as the large-flowered Cyrtandra, is a tropical plant belonging to the Gesneriaceae family. It is characterized by its large, showy flowers that typically range in color from white to pink. The plant features opposite, ovate leaves with a smooth or slightly hairy surface. It thrives in humid, shaded environments, often found in tropical rainforests. Its ornamental value makes it a sought-after species in horticulture.
